description: Powers of 2 with each digit a power of 2 (only digits 0,1,2,4,8 are used).
comments: Presumably a(6) is the last term. If a(7) exists it is greater than 2^1000000. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 09 2012
example: a(3) = 128 = 2^7, each digit of 128 is a power of 2.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 27 2001
